title: Local & Outstation Cabs
description: Cabs provide door-to-door convenience for getting around a city or for day trips to nearby locations.
sentences: For in-city travel, ride-hailing apps like Ola and Uber are the most convenient options.
For outstation trips, you can book round trips or one-way drops on these apps or dedicated services like Savaari.
Always confirm the final fare, including any tolls, state taxes, and parking fees, before starting your trip.
Before boarding, verify that the car number and driver details match what's shown in the app.
Always share your ride details with a friend or family member for safety.
dos: Use the in-app SOS or safety features if you ever feel uncomfortable or unsafe.
Check the driver's rating before the ride begins.
If possible, try to pay via the app or UPI to have a digital record of your payment.
For airport or station drops, book your cab well in advance to account for traffic.
donts: Don't board a cab if the driver's identity or car details do not match the app.
Don't get into verbal arguments with the driver, especially while on the move.
Don't leave your belongings in the cab; double-check the seats and boot before you leave.
Don't agree to off-the-app (offline) trips with the driver, as you lose all safety tracking.
